required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: App-technology to Improve Healthy Lifestyle Behaviors Among Working Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Using App-technology and a Personalized Health Plan to Improve Lifestyle Habits Among Working Adults - a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate if modern technology such as smartphone applications can be used to facilitate lifestyle changes and thereby improve health-related quality of life in gainfully employed persons in the general population in Stockholm, Sweden. The hypothesis is that at follow-up, the intervention group that use the new application will have improved health-related quality of life and other lifestyle habits including diet, physical activity and sleep, as well as biomarkers, compared to a control group.

primary_outcome.measure: Health related quality of life assessed by the RAND-36 questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: Mental and Physical Health Scores (range 0-100) are assessed using 36 questions

secondary_outcome.description: Minutes per day spent on a sedentary, light, moderate or higher activity level assessed using accelerometers

other_outcome.description: Intake of macro- and Micro nutrients are assessed based on responses to a food frequency questionnaire

other_outcome.measure: Change in eating behaviors according to the Three Factor Eating Questionnaire (TFEQ)
other_outcome.description: Emotional eating, uncontrolled eating, and cognitive restricted eating are assessed using a 21-item questionnaire
Assessed using a modified 13-item Karolinska Sleep questionnaire

other_outcome.measure: Change in perceived Purpose In Life (PIL)

other_outcome.description: Assessed using the 14-item perceived stress scale (PSS)

other_outcome.measure: Change in motivation to make lifestyle changes
other_outcome.description: Assessed using Prochaskas' transtheoretical model of behavior change

other_outcome.measure: Social support for an overall healthy lifestyle
other_outcome.description: Social support for maintenance of a healthy Lifestyle from family, friends and co-workers is assessed by a 5-item questionnaire

other_outcome.measure: Change in self-reported sitting time and physical activity
other_outcome.description: Assessed by 6 questions on sitting time and exercise

arm_group.description: Participants in the intervention group with app technology and coaching participate in a first meeting with the coach and will thereafter receive active support from the coach every 4 weeks for the duration of the intervention.
Participants in the intervention group with only app technology participate in a first meeting with the coach but do not get any additional support during follow-up.
Participants in the control group participate in baseline assessments. The control group will get access to the app and will have a meeting with a coach after 12 weeks of follow-up.

intervention.intervention_name: App-technology and active coaching to improve lifestyles behaviors
intervention.description: Access to the smartphone-app during 12 weeks. A personal health goal related to for example diet, physical activity or stress habits, is set together with a heath coach. Participants receive continuous coaching every 4 weeks during follow-up.

Access to the smartphone-app during 12 weeks. A personal health goal related to for example diet, physical activity or stress habits, is set together with a heath coach. Participants receive continuous coaching every 4 weeks during follow-up.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age or older
- Ability to communicate in Swedish
- Have access to and use a smartphone
Exclusion Criteria:
-
